item.title: Anhydrotetracycline Hydrochloride
item.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è AHT dissolves more readily in DMSO than in EtOH.
‚ö†Ô∏è DMF exhibits higher cell toxicity than DMSO, but may be used, should DMSO and EtOH not be acceptable solvents.

Materials

anhydrotetracycline hydrochloride AHT SDB 478.88 g/mol solid
(methanesulfinyl)methane (= dimethylsulfoxid) DMSO SDB Ethanol EtOH 78.13 g/mol 46.068 g/mol organic solvent alternative organic solvent

Material/Step Volume/Mass molar/%/comment

dsH2O 800 mL
HCl 25 % pH to 8.0
biotin 12.22 g 50 mM
dsH2O to 1000 mL
filter through 0.22 ¬µm vacuum filter

item.title: Primer Reconstitution form Lyophilisate
item.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è Typically, primers are supplied lyophlized with an indicated volume for initial resuspension to a concentration of 100 pmol/¬µL.

Materials

Material Molecular Weight Specifications Location
primer lyophilized ¬†
TE buffer SDBdsH2O resuspention solutionalternative resuspention solution ¬†
‚ö†Ô∏è dsH2O can be used for primer resuspension and long-term storage in most cases without noticeable issues. However, TE buffer is generally recommended, as dsH2O is slightly acidic and may, over time, contribute to primer degradation.

Recipe

Material/Step ¬†Volume/Mass ¬†molar/%/comment
¬†TE bufferdsH2O from supplier indicated volume
¬†aliquot 10% of the desired final volume (e.g. 10¬µL) for dilution 1:10 to 10 pmol/¬µL
¬†TE bufferdsH2O 90% of the desired final volume (e.g. 90 ¬µL)
¬†

Use Cases

Use Case ¬†Specifications
¬†polymerase chain reaction (PCR)
¬†DNA sequencing

Storage

¬†Conditions Duration
@ 25 ¬∞C
@ 4 ¬∞C
@ -20 ¬∞C
@ ‚Äì80 ¬∞C

item.title: Nucleospin¬Æ Plasmid Preperation
item.description:
Materials

Equipment & Devices‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
heating block
centrifuge for 15 mL tubes @ 5,000 g
centrifuge microfuge for 1.5 mL tubes @ 11,000 g
Commercial Kits‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
NucleoSpin¬Æ Plasmid manual Resuspension Buffer A1
Lysis Buffer A2
Neutralization Buffer A3
Wash Buffer AW
Wash Buffer A4
Elution Buffer AE
RNase A (lyophilized)
NucleoSpin¬Æ Plasmid Columns
Collection Tubes (2 mL)
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications Location
micropipettes and sterile pipette tips
reation tubes 1.5 mL 2/prep
1/50 preps		 for pelleting bacteria
for pre-heating buffer AE
Reagents & Solutions‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
culture of transformed bacteria 1/prep ~5mL with an OD600 ~ 0.4‚Äì0.8 (best 0.6)

Procedure

Preparations

  1. Prepare a 5 mL culture of transformed bacteria and grow them until an OD600 ~ 0.4‚Äì0.8 (best 0.6) is reached.
  2. Optionally, pre-heat a heating block to 70 ¬∞C.
  3. Optionally, pre-heat 60 ¬µL of buffer AE (elution buffer) per sapmle to 70 ¬∞C.

Harvest

  1. Pellet bacteria @ 5,000 g for 10 minutes.
0:10:00
üîî
Microfuge

‚ö†Ô∏è If no device for centrifuging 15 mL tubes at high enaugh force is available, a microfuge with multiple cycles can be used:

item.title: Imaging following agarose gel electrophoresis (AGE)
item.description:
imaging in general, but add that lanes with samples for gel extraction need to be cut off prior to imaging.

Subsequent Purification
‚ö†Ô∏è For downstream purification, cut away all lanes with samples that are intended for later gel extraction. UV light is mutagenic and can damage or alter DNA, so the band intended for purification should not be exposed to UV light. Instead, determine its position by imaging only the well containing the corresponding sample intended for UV imaging.

1. Scope of These Terms

These Terms apply to all users, including guests and users accessing protected content.

item.title: Agarose Gel Electrophoresis (AGE)
item.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è Each Sample must have a concentration of at least 20 ng/¬µL, as 20 ng is the least amount that can be detected using EtBr.
‚ÄºÔ∏è EtBr is a carcinogen and can migrate through normal nitril gloves. If possible use an alternative ike Roti GelStain. If no alternative is available use specially for EtBr approved gloves.
‚ùóÔ∏è DNA intercalators such as Roti GelStain are still carcinogenic, but do not migrate throu normal nitril gloves.

Materials

Equipment & Devices Amount Specifications ¬†Location
power source manual
casting tray
well comb
electrophoresis chamber
Commercial Kits‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications ¬†Location
micropipettes and sterile pipette tips
Reaction Tube 1.5 ml 1/gel
1/sample		 for mastermix preparation
for sample preparation
Reagents & Solutions‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
agarose default 0.35 g/50 mL gel solid
Tris-acetat-EDTA (TAE) buffer ~150 mL/gel 50 mL for gel
~100 mL as electrophoresis buffer
gel stain
ethidium bromide
Roti GelStain
0.2‚Äì0.5¬µg/mL (1‚Äì2.5 ¬µL/gel)
1 ¬µL/gel
stock 10mg/mL
ready-to-use
dsH2O see mastermix calculator below for sample dilution/for mastermix preparation
DNA loading buffer 5x see mastermix calculator below for sample preparation/for mastermix preparation
DNA ladder
HyperLadder 1kb
usually 10 ¬µL/gel
5 ¬µL/well (first and last well)
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
DNA sample at least 10 ng/well

Procedure:

Preparing the gel:

  1. Weigh the correct amount of agarose:

Hyperladder 1kb:

range of effective separation [bp] agarose gel percentage [%] agarose per gel [g/50mL]
2,000‚Äì50,000 0.5 0.25
1,000‚Äì20,000 0.6 0.30
800‚Äì12,000 0.7 0.35
800‚Äì10,000 (default) 0.8 0.40
600‚Äì10,000 0.9 0.45
400‚Äì8,000 1.0 0.50
300‚Äì7,000 1.2 0.60
200‚Äì3,000 1.5 0.75
100‚Äì2,000 2.0 1.00
25‚Äì1,000 3.0 1.50
10-500 4.0 2.00
10-300 5.0 2.50
  1. Add 50 mL of TAE buffer.
  2. Place in microwave and heat in bursts with swaying in between until boiling and until clear.
  3. Let cool down to approximately 50¬∞C in a water bath or under running water until only warm to touch.
  4. Add gel stain.
  • The standard concentration of ethidium bromide is 0.2¬µg/mL to 0.5¬µg/mL, which amounts to 1¬µL to 2.5¬µL per 50mL gel for a stock concentration of 10mg/mL.
‚ÄºÔ∏è EtBr is a carcinogen and can migrate through normal nitril gloves. If possible use an alternative ike Roti GelStain. If no alternative is available use specially for EtBr approved gloves.
  • The standard amount of Roti GelStain is 1¬µL per 50mL gel.
‚ùóÔ∏è DNA intercalators, such as Roti GelStain, are still carcinogenic, but do not migrate throu normal nitril gloves.

Casting the Gel:

  1. Place the casting tray into the gel chamber rotated 90¬∞ to prevent the gel from running in the chamber.
  2. Place the well comb.
  3. Pour in the gel from a corner on the opposite site from the well comb.
  4. Remove all bubbles, especially near the comb or where the DNA will be running, if necessary.
  5. Let the gel solidify for approximately 30 minutes.

Preparing the DNA:

‚ÑπÔ∏è Prepare a mastermix when doing multiple samples with similar DNA concentration containing dsH2O and DNA loading buffer 5x. Use number of samples plus at least one for the mastermix volume multiplyer.
1. Prepare a Mastermix:
Volume V [¬µL] Reagent Concentration c1 [ng/¬µL]
Mass m1 [ng]		 Concentration c2 [ng/¬µL]
Mass m2 [ng]
1 ¬µL DNA loading buffer
3 ¬µL dsH2O
= 4 ¬µL
Mastermix Preparation Calculator

Number of samples:

Desired well volume:

~100 mL as electrophoresis buffer
gel stain
ethidium bromide

1 ¬µL/gel
stock 10mg/mL
ready-to-use
dsH2O see mastermix calculator below for sample dilution/for mastermix preparation
DNA loading buffer 5x see mastermix calculator below for sample preparation/for mastermix preparation
DNA ladder

usually 10 ¬µL/gel
5 ¬µL/well (first and last well)
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location

Procedure:

Preparing the gel:

  1. Weigh the correct amount of agarose:

Hyperladder 1kb:

range of effective separation [bp] agarose gel percentage [%] agarose per gel [g/50mL]
2,000‚Äì50,000 0.5 0.25
1,000‚Äì20,000 0.6 0.30
800‚Äì12,000 0.7 0.35
800‚Äì10,000 (default) 0.8 0.40
600‚Äì10,000 0.9 0.45
400‚Äì8,000 1.0 0.50
300‚Äì7,000 1.2 0.60
200‚Äì3,000 1.5 0.75
100‚Äì2,000 2.0 1.00
25‚Äì1,000 3.0 1.50
10-500 4.0 2.00
10-300 5.0 2.50
  1. Add 50 mL of TAE buffer.
  2. Place in microwave and heat in bursts with swaying in between until boiling and until clear.
  3. Let cool down to approximately 50¬∞C in a water bath or under running water until only warm to touch.
  4. Add gel stain.
  • The standard concentration of ethidium bromide is 0.2¬µg/mL to 0.5¬µg/mL, which amounts to 1¬µL to 2.5¬µL per 50mL gel for a stock concentration of 10mg/mL.
‚ÄºÔ∏è EtBr is a carcinogen and can migrate through normal nitril gloves. If possible use an alternative ike Roti GelStain. If no alternative is available use specially for EtBr approved gloves.
  • The standard amount of Roti GelStain is 1¬µL per 50mL gel.
‚ùóÔ∏è DNA intercalators, such as Roti GelStain, are still carcinogenic, but do not migrate throu normal nitril gloves.

Casting the Gel:

  1. Place the casting tray into the gel chamber rotated 90¬∞ to prevent the gel from running in the chamber.
  2. Place the well comb.
  3. Pour in the gel from a corner on the opposite site from the well comb.
  4. Remove all bubbles, especially near the comb or where the DNA will be running, if necessary.
  5. Let the gel solidify for approximately 30 minutes.

Preparing the DNA:

  1. Mix the whole PCR reaction mixture with the appropriate amount of DNA loading buffer.

¬†store @ 4 ¬∞C or in 50 mL aliquots @ ‚Äì20 ¬∞C
0:30:00
üîî

item.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è Working concentrations in aqueous solutions are only stable for a few hours.
‚ÄºÔ∏è PMSF is rapidly absorbed through skin and is highly neurotoxic. Handle exclusively in a chemical fume hood and consider wearing double gloves. Refer to the Safety Data Sheet SDS for further information.

Materials

Ethanol EtOH Methanol MeOH 46.07 g/mol 32.04 g/mol organic solvent alternative organic solvent

item.title: Bacterial Plasmid Preparation Culture
item.description:
Materials

Equipment & Devices‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
laminar airflow workbench
shaker incubator
photometer for measuring OD600
Commercial Kits‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications Location
micropipettes and sterile pipette tips
pipetting aid and serological pipette
photometer cuvette 1/culture
liquid culture tubes or sterile falcon tubes 15 mL 1/culture
sterile reaction tube 1 for antibiotic aliquot
Reagents & Solutions‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
Luria-Bertani liquid medium 6 mL/culture
suitable antibiotic stock solution, tpically 1000x
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
LB agar plate with transformed bacteria 1/plasmid

Procedure

Preparation

  1. Transform a suitable strain of bacteria and plate transformed bacteria on a LB-agar Plate containing appropriate selection markers (Antibiotic, X-Gal).
  2. Prepare 6 mL of sterile LB medium per clone.

Culture

‚ö†Ô∏è To reduce risk of contamination, all subsequent steps can be carried out under laminar airflow.
  1. Transfer 1 mL of the 6 mL LB medium into a photometer cuvette for the zero value.
  2. Transfer 5 mL of LB medium into the sterile 15 mL falcon tube or liquid culturing tube.
  3. Supplement the 5 mL of LB medium with a suitable antibiotic.
‚ùóÔ∏è To minimize exposure to microorganisms, all subsequent steps should be carried out under laminar airflow.
  1. Pick a suitable clone with a pipette tip.
  2. Optionally streak pipette tip over fresh plate as a backup.
  3. Drop the pipette tip into the prepared medium.
  4. Incubate the culture @ 37 ¬∞C and shaking @ 250 rpm for approximately 2‚Äì4 h until an OD600 ~ 0.4‚Äì0.8 (best 0.6) is reached.
Incubation @ 30 ¬∞C and shaking @ 250 rpm overnight is also possible.
2:00:00
üîî
3:00:00
üîî
4:00:00
üîî
  1. Document the start time and refer to BiochemProtocols bacterial growth calculator.

item.description:
Materials

Equipment & Devices‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
laminar airflow workbench
shaker incubator
photometer for measuring OD600
centrifuge for 50 mL falcon tubes @ 3,000-6,000 g
centrifuge microfuge for 1.5 mL tubes @ 20,000 g
end-over-end rotator for fitting 10 x 50m mL falcon tubes/culture
ultrasonicator
bucket of ice
Commercial Kits‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications Location
micropipettes and sterile pipette tips
pipetting aid and serological pipettes
photometer cuvette 2/culture
liquid culture tubes or sterile falcon tubes 15 mL 1/culture for pre culture
sterile reaction tube 1.5 mL 1/workflow
2/culture
20/culture		 for antibiotic aliquot
for culture aliquots (pre- and post-induction)
for centrifugation following lysis
Erlenmeyer Flask 1 L 1/culture
sterile falcon tubes 50 mL 10/culture
1/culture		 for harvesting
for recombining supernatants
Reagents & Solutions‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
Luria-Bertani liquid medium 6 mL/culture
500 mL/culture		 for the pre culture
for the main culture
Luria-Bertani agar plate 1/culture for clone backup
suitable antibiotic stock solution, typically 1000x
phosphate-buffered saline PBS 50¬†¬µL/culture
50 ¬µL/culture
50 ¬µL/culture		 for pre-induction aliquot
for post-induction aliquot
50mL for precipitate
SDS-PAGE sample buffer 2x 50¬†¬µL/culture
50 ¬µL/culture
50 ¬µL/culture		 for pre-induction aliquot
for post-induction aliquot
50mL for precipitate
suitable induction chemical
e.g. anhydrotetracycline AHT 2 mg/mL
e.g. isopropyl-Œ≤-D-thiogalactopyranosid IPTG 1 M
e.g. 50 ¬µL
e.g. 250 ¬µL
for a final concentration of 0.2 ¬µg/mL
for a final concentration of 0.5 mM
tris-HCl-NaCl-MgCl2 bacterial lysis buffer for 20 mL supplemented lysis buffer
phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride PMSF 100 mM 200¬†¬µL for 20 mL supplemented lysis buffer (1 mM)
aprotenin 1.54 mM 20 ¬µL for 20 mL supplemented lysis buffer (1.54 ¬µM)
leupeptin 10mM 20 ¬µL for 20 mL supplemented lysis buffer (10 ¬µM)
pepstatin A 1mM 200¬µL for 20 mL supplemented lysis buffer (10¬µM)
sucrose 3.423 g/clone for 20 mL supplemented lysis buffer (500mM, 17.1 %)
Triton-X-100 100 ¬µL/clone for 20 mL supplemented lysis buffer (0.5 %)
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
LB agar plate with transformed bacteria 1/plasmid

Procedure

Preparation

  1. Transform a suitable strain of bacteria and plate transformed bacteria on a LB-agar Plate containing appropriate selection markers (Antibiotic, X-Gal).
  2. Prepare 6 mL of sterile LB medium per clone.
  3. Prepare additional 500 mL of sterile LB medium in a 1 L Erlenmeyer flask per clone.
‚ö†Ô∏è Adjust volume as needed. The Erlenmeyer flask should be able to hold at least double the volume of LB medium used to allow for sufficient aeration.

Pre-Culture

‚ö†Ô∏è To reduce risk of contamination, all subsequent steps can be carried out under laminar airflow.
  1. Transfer 1 mL of the 6 mL LB medium into a photometer cuvette for the zero value.
  2. Transfer 5 mL of LB medium into the sterile 15 mL falcon tube or liquid culturing tube.
  3. Supplement the 5 mL of LB medium with a suitable antibiotic.
‚ùóÔ∏è To minimize exposure to microorganisms, all subsequent steps should be carried out under laminar airflow.
  1. Pick a suitable clone with a pipette tip.
  2. Optionally streak pipette tip over fresh plate as a backup.
  3. Drop the pipette tip into the prepared medium.
  4. Incubate the culture @ 37 ¬∞C and shaking @ 250 rpm for approximately 2‚Äì4 h until an OD600 ~ 0.4‚Äì0.8 (best 0.6) is reached.
Incubation @ 30 ¬∞C and shaking @ 250 rpm overnight is also possible.
2:00:00
üîî
3:00:00
üîî
4:00:00
üîî
  1. Document the start time and refer to BiochemProtocols bacterial growth calculator.

item.title: Bacterial Transformation
item.description:
Materials

Equipment & Devices‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
laminar airflow workbench manual
heating block manual with shaker function
bucket of ice
Commercial Kits‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications Location
micropipettes and sterile pipette tips
reaction tube 1.5 mL 1/transformation for LB medium
Reagents & Solutions‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
Luria-Bertani medium 1 mL/one-shot
LB agar plate 2/one-shot with suitable selection antibiotic
with X-gal for blue-white selection
X-gal for blue/white selection if not already in plate
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
plasmid 1‚Äì10 ng (e.g. 0.5‚Äì5 ¬µL of 2 ng/¬µL)
100-200 ng (e.g. 1-2 ¬µL of 100 ng/¬µL)		 for standard transformations
for difficult transformations
one-shot of suitable competent bacteria 1/transformation

Procedure

Selecting a suitable Strain

Strain Application Features
E. coli DH5Œ± medium-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli TOP10 high-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli XL1blue plasmid DNA expression
with blue/white screening
E. coli BL21(DE3) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli BL21(DE3) pLysS (toxic) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
T7 Inhibitor
E. coli Rosetta(DE3) (eucaryotic) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli Rosetta(DE3) pLysS (eucaryotic) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
T7 Inhibitor
E. coli C41(DE3) toxic protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli C43(DE3) toxic membrane protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase

Preparations

  1. Thaw a one-shot of competent bacteria per transformation on ice for approximately 5 minutes.
0:05:00
üîî
  1. Thaw the Plasmid on ice.
  2. Pre-warm 1000 ¬µL of LB medium per transformation to 37 ¬∞C.

Transformation

  1. Add 1‚Äì10 ng (up to 100-200 ng for difficult dransformations) of plasmid DNA to a one shot of 50‚Äì100 ¬µL of competent cells.
  2. Mix the bacteria by flicking or gentle stirring.
  3. Incubate transformation mix on ice for 30 minutes.
0:30:00
üîî
  1. Pre-heat a heating block or water bath to 42 ¬∞C.
  2. Incubate transformation mix in a heating block or water bath @ 42 ¬∞C for 45 to 60 seconds.
0:01:00
üîî
  1. Incubate transformation mix on ice for 5 minutes.
0:05:00
üîî
  1. Add 900 ¬µL LB medium to the transformation mix.
  2. Incubate transformation mix on a heating block @ 37 ¬∞C and @ 250 rpm for 1 h.
1:00:00
üîî

Plate Preparation

  1. Take two LB-agar Plates containing the appropriate antibiotic out of the fridge and let them warm up to RT.
  2. For blue/white selection plate 20 ¬µL of X-Gal on the Plates and let dry before plating any bacteria.

Plating

  1. Plate 100 ¬µL of the 1000 ŒºL bacterial suspension on one of the LB agar Plate.
  2. Centrifuge the residual 900 ¬µL @ 11,000 g for 30 s.
0:00:30
üîî
  1. Discard the supernatant.
  2. Remove residual supernatant with a 100 ¬µL pipette.
  3. Resuspend the bacteria pellet in 100 ¬µL LB medium.
  4. Plate the 100 ¬µL on the second LB agar Plate.
  5. Incubate the plates at 37 ¬∞C overnight or for blue/white selection for up to 48 h.
‚ÑπÔ∏è Plates can be stored @ 4¬∞C for up to four weeks.

Procede with Suitable Protocol

  • Bacterial Expression Culture
  • Bacterial Plasmid Preparation Culture

item.title: Chemically Competent Bacteria Generation
item.description:
Materials

Equipment & Devices‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
shaker incubator for incubation @ 30 or 37 ¬∞C
centrifuge for centrifugation of 50 mL falcons @ 5,000 g
photometer for measurement of OD600
cool room @ 4 ¬∞C
Commercial Kits‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
Containers & Consumables Amount Specifications ¬†Location
micropipettes and sterile pipette tips
photometer cuvette 2/strain
Erlenmeyer flask 200 mL 1/strain
sterile reaction tubes 1.5 mL 80/strain
sterile falcon tubes 50 mL 3/strain
sterile falcon tubes 15 mL 2/strain
Reagents & Solutions‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
Luria-Bertani agar plates 1/strain no antibiotic
Luria-Bertani liquid medium 110 mL/strain
Inoue Transformation Buffer 50 mL/strain 10mM PIPES/10 mM MOPES (pH 6.8 with acetic acid)
manganese chloride MnCl2 55mM
calcium chloride CaCl2 15mM
potassium chloride KCl 250 mM
(Methanesulfinyl)methane = dimethyl sulfoxide DMSO 750 ¬µL/strain for 7.5 % in Inoue storage buffer
glycerol 85 % 1250 ¬µL/strain for 10.625 % in Inoue storage buffer
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications ¬†Location
one-shot of suitable competent bacteria 1/strain

Procedure

Selecting a suitable Strain

Strain Application Features
E. coli DH5Œ± medium-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli TOP10 high-yield plasmid DNA expression
(with blue/white screening)
E. coli XL1blue plasmid DNA expression
with blue/white screening
E. coli BL21(DE3) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli BL21(DE3) pLysS (toxic) protein expression T7 Inhibitor
E. coli Rosetta(DE3) (eucaryotic) protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli C41(DE3) toxic protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase
E. coli C43(DE3) toxic membrane protein expression lacUV5 promoter
for IPTG induced expression of t-RNA polymerase

Preparations

  1. Prepare one LB-agar Plate without any antibiotics.
  2. Prepare 110 mL of LB medium.

Plating Bacteria

  1. Choose a desired strain of Escherichia coli cells.
  2. Plate a one shot directly on a LB-agar Plate.
  3. Let the bacteria grow over night @ 37 ¬∞C.

Pre-culture

  1. Transfer 1 mL of the 110 mL LB medium into a photometer cuvette for the zero value.
  2. Transfer 5 mL of the 109 mL LB medium into a sterile 15 mL falcon tube.
  3. Pick a suitable clone with pipette tip.
  4. Drop pipette tip into the 5 mL of LB medium.
  5. Incubate pre-culture @ 37 ¬∞C and shaking @ 250 rpm for approximately 2‚Äì4 h until an OD600 ~ 0.4‚Äì0.8 (best 0.6) is reached or incubate @ 30 ¬∞C and shaking @ 250 rpm overnight.
2:00:00
üîî
3:00:00
üîî
4:00:00
üîî

Main-culture

  1. Transfer 1 mL of the 104 mL LB medium into a photometer cuvette for the zero value.
  2. Transfer 100 mL LB-medium into a sterile 200 mL Erlenmeyer flask.
  3. Inoculate the 100 mL LB-medium with the pre-culture.
  4. Incubate batch @ 37 ¬∞C and shaking @ 250 rpm for approximately 2‚Äì4 h until an OD600 of 0.4 to 0.8 (best 0.6) is reached.
2:00:00
üîî
3:00:00
üîî
4:00:00
üîî

Preparations Before Harvesting

  1. Prepare 50 mL of Inoue transformation buffer from your 10x stock or by supplementing 50mL of PIPES (or alternatively MOPES) buffer 10 mM (pH 6.8 with acetic acid) with MnCl2 55 mM, CaCl2 15 mM and KCl 250 mM and cool on ice until further use.
  2. Prepare 10 mL of Inoue storage buffer by supplementing 8 mL of Inoue transformation buffer with 750 ¬µL of DMSO (7.5 %) and 1250 ¬µL of Glycerol 85% (10.625 %) and cool on ice until further use.
  3. Pre-cool 80 x sterile 1.5 mL reaction tubes.
  4. Pre-cool a centrifuge to 4 ¬∞C for harvesting @ 3000‚Äì6000 g.

Cell harvesting

  1. Transfer the 100 mL of culture into 2 x sterile 50 mL falcon tubes.
  2. Harvest cells by centrifugation @ 3000‚Äì6000 g and @ 4 ¬∞C for 10 minutes.
0:10:00
üîî
  1. Discard the medium and let pellet dry overhead on paper towels for 2 minutes.
0:02:00
üîî

Generating Competency

  1. Resuspend the pellet in 16 mL of ice-cold Inoue transformation buffer each by rotating end-over-end.
  2. Harvest cells by centrifugation @ 3000‚Äì6000 g and @ 4 ¬∞C for 10 minutes.
0:10:00
üîî
  1. Discard the medium and let pellet dry overhead on paper towels for 2 minutes.
0:02:00
üîî

Storage

  1. Resuspend the pellet in 4 mL of ice-cold Inoue storage buffer each by rotating end-over-end for 10 minutes.
0:10:00
üîî
  1. Prepare some liquid nitrogen.
  2. Aliquot the cells in 100 ¬µL fractions in the pre-cooled sterile 1.5 mL reaction tubes.
  3. Immediately freeze aliquots in liquid nitrogen.
  4. Store the one shots at ‚Äì60 ¬∞C.
‚ö†Ô∏è Cells from here on are extremely sensitive to temperature increases.

Proceed with Suitable Protocol

for the eluted protein
for glycerol
for 1 SDS-PAGE aliquot per 2.5 mL culture

tris-HCl-NaCl-MgCl2 bacterial lysis buffer (or buffer W) 10 ml/5 mL lysate:
2 CV (400 ¬µL)

for equilibration
for washing
for column regeneration
biotin elution buffer (or buffer BXT) 1 mL/5 mL culture
glycerol 85 % 1000¬†¬µL/5 mL culture for storage buffer
deionized sterilized Water dsH2O 4 ¬µL/5 mL culture for SDS-PAGE aliquots
Laemmli SDS-PAGE sample buffer 2x 20¬†¬µL/5 mL culture for SDS-PAGE aliquots
sodium hydroxide NaOH 10 mM 6 CV (1200 ¬µL) for column regeneration
Biological Materials‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä Amount Specifications Location
bacterial cell lysate from Bacterial Protein Expression Culture

Procedure

Preparations

  1. Prepare and pre-cool 10 mL Tris-HCl-NaCl-MgCl2 bacterial lysis buffer as a equibrilation and wash buffer per 5 mL bacterial lysate from 500 mL bacterial culture volume (or 10 mL buffer W).
  2. Prepare and pre-cool 1 mL biotin elution buffer per 5 mL bacterial lysate from 500 mL bacterial culture volume (or 1 mL buffer BXT).

Equilibrating the Column

  1. Place the column onto a stand in the cool room @ 2-8 ¬∞C.
  2. Remove the top cap.
  3. Twist of bottom cap.
  4. Let the storage buffer flow through.
  5. Equilibrate the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  6. Equilibrate the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).

First Binding the Protein and Washing

  1. Add 0.1 to 2 mL of sample onto the column and let the sample flow through completely.
  2. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  3. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  4. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  5. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  6. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).

First Elution

  1. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  2. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  3. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  4. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  5. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).

First Storage

  1. Add 500 ¬µL glycerol 85 % (approximately 615 mg) to a sterile 1.5 mL reaction tube.
‚ö†Ô∏è Pipetting highly viscous glycerol can be challenging and may lead to inaccurate measurements. Weighing is often a more reliable alternative.
  1. After the final elution add the eluate to the prepared glycerol for a final concentration of 38.6 % (4.93 M).
  2. Take a 6 ¬µL aliquot and mix with 2 ¬µL dsH2O and 10 ¬µL of 2x Laemmli sample buffer and freeze @ -20 ¬∞C for later SDS-PAGE analysis.
  3. Optionally aliquot the rest in 50‚Äì100 ¬µL fractions.
  4. Store @ ‚Äì20 ¬∞C for middle term storage or ‚Äì80 ¬∞C for long term storage.

Column regeneration

‚ö†Ô∏è The collumn can be used 2? times.
  1. Add 6 column bed volumes (1200 ¬µL) of fresh NaOH 100 mM to the column.
  2. Let the NaOH pass through completely.
  3. Wash column immediately with 8 column bed volumes (1600 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).

Second Binding the Protein and Washing

  1. Add 0.1 to 2 mL of sample onto the column and let the sample flow through completely.
  2. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  3. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  4. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  5. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).
  6. Wash the column with 1 column bed volume (200 ¬µL) of wash buffer (or buffer W).

Second Elution

  1. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  2. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  3. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  4. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).
  5. Elute the protein by applying 0.5 CV (100 ¬µL) of elution buffer (or Buffer BXT).

Second Storage

  1. Add 500 ¬µL glycerol 85 % (approximately 615 mg) to a sterile 1.5 mL reaction tube.
‚ö†Ô∏è Pipetting highly viscous glycerol can be challenging and may lead to inaccurate measurements. Weighing is often a more reliable alternative.
  1. After the final elution add the eluate to the prepared glycerol for a final concentration of 38.6 % (4.93 M).
  2. Take a 6 ¬µL aliquot and mix with 2 ¬µL dsH2O and 10 ¬µL of 2x Laemmli sample buffer and freeze @ -20 ¬∞C for later SDS-PAGE analysis.
  3. Optionally aliquot the rest in 50‚Äì100 ¬µL fractions.
  4. Store @ ‚Äì20 ¬∞C for middle term storage or ‚Äì80 ¬∞C for long term storage.

Column storage

  1. Overlay the resin with 2000 ¬µL buffer W.
  2. Close column with top lid.
  3. Close column with bottom cap.

Procede with Suitable Protocol
